org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact

Class ContactManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact.ContactManager

  • public class ContactManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Maintains ContactConstraints between Bodys.

    This class performs the ContactConstraint warm starting and manages contact listening.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.5
    Author:
    William Bittle

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<ContactConstraint> list
      The current list of contact constraints
      protected java.util.List<ContactListener> listeners
      The list of contact listeners (this is reassigned each time updateContacts() is called)
      protected java.util.Map<ContactConstraintId,ContactConstraint> map
      Map for fast look up of ContactConstraints
      protected World world
      The world this contact manager belongs to

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContactManager

        public ContactManager(World world)
        Optional constructor.
        Parameters:
        world - the World this contact manager belongs to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if world is null
        Since:
        3.0.3

      • ContactManager

        public ContactManager(World world,
              Capacity initialCapacity)
        Full constructor.

        The initial capacity is used to help performance in the event that the developer knows the number of bodies the world will contain. The ContactManager will grow past the initial capacity if necessary.

        Parameters:
        world - the World this contact manager belongs to
        initialCapacity - the estimated number of Bodys
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if world or initialCapacity is null
        Since:
        3.1.1

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(ContactConstraint contactConstraint)
        Adds a ContactConstraint to the contact manager.
        Parameters:
        contactConstraint - the ContactConstraint

      • remove

        public boolean remove(ContactConstraint contactConstraint)
        Removes a ContactConstraint from the contact manager.

        This method does not notify the ContactListener.

        Parameters:
        contactConstraint - the ContactConstraint
        Returns:
        boolean true if the contact was removed
        Since:
        3.1.1

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the list of ContactConstraints.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the contact manager, removing all ContactConstraints from the warm starting cache and ContactConstraint list.

      • shiftCoordinates

        public void shiftCoordinates(Vector2 shift)
        Shifts stored contacts by the given coordinate shift.

        Typically this method should not be called directly. Instead use the World.shiftCoordinates(Vector2) method to move the entire world.

        Parameters:
        shift - the distance to shift along the x and y axes
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • updateContacts

        public void updateContacts()
        Updates the contact manager with the new contacts, performs warm starting, and notifies of any contact events.

        Warm starts the ContactConstraints using the previous ContactConstraints accumulated impulses if available given their ManifoldPointIds.

        This method will notify using the ContactListener of any contact events excluding the ContactListener.preSolve(ContactPoint) and ContactListener.postSolve(SolvedContactPoint) methods.

        Since:
        1.0.2
        See Also:
        ContactListener

      • preSolveNotify

        public void preSolveNotify()
        Called before the contact constraints are solved.

      • postSolveNotify

        public void postSolveNotify()
        Called after the contact constraints have been solved.

      • isListEmpty

        public boolean isListEmpty()
        Returns true if there are no contacts in this ContactManager's list.

        Contacts are added to this contact manager via the add(ContactConstraint) method. When the updateContacts() method is called these contacts are updated with the cached ContactConstraint's impulses to warm start the solution.

        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        3.1.1

      • isCacheEmpty

        public boolean isCacheEmpty()
        Returns true if the ContactConstraint warm starting cache is empty.

        The warm starting cache contains the previous time step's ContactConstraints and their computed impulses. These impulses from the last time step are used to warm start the new contacts added via the add(ContactConstraint) method. Warm starting of the ContactConstraints allow the global solution to converge quicker and eliminate jitter.

        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        3.1.1

      • isEmpty

        @Deprecated
public boolean isEmpty()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns true if there are no contacts in this contact manager.
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        3.0.3
